title: Honoring Betty Martuscello upon the occasion of her designation as recipient of the Everyday Hero Award
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE  RESOLUTION  honoring Betty Martuscello upon the occasion of
her designation as recipient of the Everyday Hero Award by the  American
Federation of Teachers

WHEREAS, It is the practice of this Legislative Body to take note of and
publicly  acknowledge  individuals of remarkable integrity and character
who have inspired and brought pride to our majestic  Empire  State  with
their strong contributions to the community and model citizenship; and
  WHEREAS,  Attendant to such concern, and in full accord with its long-
standing traditions, this Legislative Body  is  justly  proud  to  honor
Betty  Martuscello  upon the occasion of her designation as recipient of
the Everyday Hero Award by the American Federation  of  Teachers  (AFT);
and
  WHEREAS, Betty Martuscello, a retired teacher from Marlboro, New York,
was  commended  at  the Marlboro Board of Education Meeting in December,
2010, for her exceptional commitment to her community and  its  schools;
and
  WHEREAS,  The  AFT  represents 1.5 million teachers, paraprofessionals
and other school-related personnel as well as higher  education  faculty
and  professional  staff; also included in the organization are federal,
state and local government employees,  nurses,  healthcare  workers  and
early childhood educators; and
  WHEREAS,  The  award  recognizes  an individual or group who has had a
profound impact on the workplace or has performed extraordinary communi-
ty service outside of the job; and
  WHEREAS, When Betty Martuscello retired after 37  years  of  teaching,
she  couldn't  stop helping students and schools; she has taken the lead
in creating and raising funds for the 1,000 Book Club, which buys  pack-
ets  of  books  and  contributes  them to local libraries for elementary
students to use; and
  WHEREAS, A woman of great compassion and generosity, Betty Martuscello
is affectionately known as the "Flower Lady" of Marlboro because of  her
work  organizing, selling and distributing flowers three times a year to
raise money for college aid to local students; and
  WHEREAS, In addition, Betty Martuscello is part of an effort to  raise
money  to  build playgrounds at Marlboro's elementary schools; she helps
her church prepare and distribute holiday food baskets to  needy  house-
holds,  and assists with fundraising for the local Lions Club's scholar-
ship fund; she is also an active member in the  New  York  State  United
Teachers Retiree Council 13; and
  WHEREAS, Individuals who give of their time and energies and serve the
best interests of their communities are an asset beyond remuneration and
cannot be sufficiently extolled; Betty Martuscello has given not only of
her time and energies but also of her competence, intelligence and lead-
ership; and
  WHEREAS,  It  is the sense of this Legislative Body that when individ-
uals of such noble aims and accomplishments are brought  to  our  atten-
tion,  they  should  be celebrated and recognized by all the citizens of
the great State of New York; now, therefore, be it
  RESOLVED, That this Legislative Body pause  in  its  deliberations  to
honor  Betty Martuscello upon the occasion of her designation as recipi-
ent of the Everyday Hero Award by the American Federation  of  Teachers;
and be it further
  RESOLVED, That a copy of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be tran-
smitted to Betty Martuscello.
